qas.question: What party wanted to make Taiwanese a second official language?
What year was it proposed to make Taiwanese the second official language?
How was the proposal taken from mainland and aboriginal groups?
Hoklo objected to the proposal because it would increase what tensions?
What was the fate of the proposal to make Taiwanese the second official language?

plausible_answers.text: making Taiwanese a second official language

qas.question: What did Mainlander groups suggest in 2002?
How many seats in the legislature did Taiwanese aboriginal groups have in 2002?

plausible_answers.text: Mainlander groups but also from Hakka and Taiwanese aboriginal groups

qas.question: What groups suggested making Taiwanese a second official language?
What would increase according to Taiwan independence supporters who strongly opposed the proposal?
What happened to the proposal about the Legislative Yuan seats?

context: In <a1_0>2002<a1_0/>, the <a0_0>Taiwan Solidarity Union<a0_0/>, a party with <b6_0>about 10%<b6_0/> of the Legislative Yuan seats at the time, suggested <b5_0>making Taiwanese a second official language<b5_0/>. <a2_0>This proposal encountered strong opposition<a2_0/> not only from <b7_0>Mainlander groups but also from Hakka and Taiwanese aboriginal groups<b7_0/> who felt that it would slight their home languages, as well as others including Hoklo who objected to the proposal on logistical grounds and on the grounds that it would <b8_0>increase <a3_0>ethnic<a3_0/> tensions<b8_0/>. Because of these objections, support for this measure was lukewarm among moderate Taiwan independence supporters, and <a4_0><b9_0>the proposal did not pass<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
